org.eclipse.gef4.mvc.fx.policies

Class FXMarqueeOnDragPolicy

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.eclipse.gef4.mvc.policies.AbstractPolicy<VR>
      • org.eclipse.gef4.mvc.policies.AbstractInteractionPolicy<javafx.scene.Node>
        • org.eclipse.gef4.mvc.fx.policies.AbstractFXInteractionPolicy
          • org.eclipse.gef4.mvc.fx.policies.FXMarqueeOnDragPolicy
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IAdaptable.Bound<IVisualPart<javafx.scene.Node,? extends javafx.scene.Node>>, IFXOnDragPolicy, IPolicy<javafx.scene.Node>

    public class FXMarqueeOnDragPolicy
extends AbstractFXInteractionPolicy
implements IFXOnDragPolicy
    The FXMarqueeOnDragPolicy is an IFXOnDragPolicy that performs marquee selection when the mouse is dragged. The start and end position of the mouse span a marquee area. Everything within that area will be selected.

    • Property Summary

      • findContainedNodes

        public static java.util.List<javafx.scene.Node> findContainedNodes(javafx.scene.Node root,
                                                                   double x0,
                                                                   double y0,
                                                                   double x1,
                                                                   double y1)
        Returns a List of all Nodes that are descendants of the given root Node and fully contained within the bounds specified by [x0, y0, x1, y1].
        Parameters:
        root - The root Node.
        x0 - The minimum x-coordinate.
        y0 - The minimum y-coordinate.
        x1 - The maximum x-coordinate.
        y1 - The maximum y-coordinate.
        Returns:
        A List containing all Nodes that are descendants of the given root Node and fully contained within the specified bounds.

      • addFeedback

        protected void addFeedback()
        Adds a feedback rectangle to the root part of the host . The rectangle will show the marquee area.

      • drag

        public void drag(javafx.scene.input.MouseEvent e,
                 Dimension delta)
        Description copied from interface: IFXOnDragPolicy
        This callback method is invoked when the mouse is moved while a button is pressed.
        Specified by:
        drag in interface IFXOnDragPolicy
        Parameters:
        e - The original MouseEvent.
        delta - The mouse offset since IFXOnDragPolicy.press(MouseEvent) (in pixel).

      • dragAborted

        public void dragAborted()
        Description copied from interface: IFXOnDragPolicy
        This callback method is invoked when the mouse drag gesture is aborted, i.e. the gesture ends unexpectedly, without a mouse release event being fired. The policy can decide to commit or roll back its transaction. The execution transaction to which operations are added during a mouse drag gesture is closed after execution of this method.
        Specified by:
        dragAborted in interface IFXOnDragPolicy

      • getCursorSupport

        protected CursorSupport getCursorSupport()
        Returns the CursorSupport of this policy.

        The CursorSupport of this policy.

        Returns a List containing all IContentParts that are corresponding to the given List of Nodes.
        Parameters:
        nodes - The List of Nodes for which the corresponding IContentParts are returned.
        Returns:
        A List containing all IContentParts that are corresponding to the given Nodes.

        public void hideIndicationCursor()
        Description copied from interface: IFXOnDragPolicy
        Restores the original mouse cursor when it was previously changed by a call to IFXOnDragPolicy.showIndicationCursor(KeyEvent) or IFXOnDragPolicy.showIndicationCursor(MouseEvent).

      • isMarquee

        protected boolean isMarquee(javafx.scene.input.MouseEvent event)
        Returns true if the given MouseEvent should trigger marquee selection. Otherwise returns false. Per default returns true if the event target is not registered.
        Parameters:
        event - The MouseEvent in question.
        Returns:
        true if the given KeyEvent should trigger zooming, otherwise false.

      • press

        public void press(javafx.scene.input.MouseEvent e)
        Description copied from interface: IFXOnDragPolicy
        This callback method is invoked when a mouse button is pressed on the host, which starts a mouse drag gesture. An execution transaction is opened prior to execution of this method to which all operations are added that are executed during a mouse drag gesture.
        Specified by:
        press in interface IFXOnDragPolicy
        Parameters:
        e - The original MouseEvent

      • release

        public void release(javafx.scene.input.MouseEvent e,
                    Dimension delta)
        Description copied from interface: IFXOnDragPolicy
        This callback method is invoked when the initially pressed mouse button is released, which ends the gesture. The execution transaction to which operations are added during a mouse drag gesture is closed after execution of this method.
        Specified by:
        release in interface IFXOnDragPolicy
        Parameters:
        e - The original MouseEvent.
        delta - The mouse offset since IFXOnDragPolicy.press(MouseEvent) (in pixel).

      • showIndicationCursor

        public boolean showIndicationCursor(javafx.scene.input.KeyEvent event)
        Description copied from interface: IFXOnDragPolicy
        Changes the mouse cursor depending on the given KeyEvent to indicate the action that is performed by this policy. The return value indicates if the mouse cursor was changed or not.
        Specified by:
        showIndicationCursor in interface IFXOnDragPolicy
        Parameters:
        event - The KeyEvent that initiated the determination of an indication cursor.
        Returns:
        true if the mouse cursor was changed, otherwise false.
